attributes.action: confirm its permanent commitment to the Falklands and South Georgia in the face of aggression from Argentina and Bolivia and to increase the garrison, radar coverage, air cover and naval presence to a level to allow the islands to defend themselves for the weeks that it would take to send a full task-force to the South Atlantic.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In 1982 two hundred and fifty British servicemen gave their lives to defend the Falklands and their two-thousand British citizens. Now, twenty-six years later, our armed forces in general and Navy in particular, are a shadow of the past. This is entirely thanks to the short-sightedness and cowardice of successive governments, who were more concerned with civil-service pensions and their own salaries than with investing in the defence of sovereign British territory. Mr. Brown, it is time to act.
